news.title: People Choice’ award for ANSA
news.content:
Zimpapers SportsTHE Annual National Sports Awards (ANSA) are set to return after a five-year hiatus with the ceremony penciled for a Harare lodge on March 30.

This years awards will run under the theme Setting the gold standard and will see a slew of new additions and innovations aimed at making the ANSA a world-class event.Among these is the addition of a Peoples Choice award, which is set to make its debut at this years edition and will feature 15 athletes from 12 local disciplines.

The nominees in this category include Zimbabwe Chevrons talisman Sikandar Raza, France-base basketball ace Vitalis Chikoko, Paige Van Der Westhuizen (swimming), Sasha Chimedza (tennis), Tapiwanashe Makarawu (athletics), Tapiwa Mafura (rugby), Benjamin Lock (tennis), Kellis Ndlovu (cricket), Isaac Mpofu (athletics), Scott Vincent (golf), Felistus Kwangwa (netball), Khama Billiat (football), Temba Gorimbo (Mixed Martial Arts), Chido Maenzanise (strong man), Kudakwashe Chiwandire (boxing).Voting for this award will be done primarily online.

As it pertains to the main awards, 10 categories are currently on the card and these include Junior Sportsman of the Year, Junior Sportswoman of the Year with a Disability, Junior Sportsman of the Year with a Disability, Sportswoman of the Year, Sportsman of the Year, Sportsman of the Year with a Disability, Outstanding Professional Male Boxer, Outstanding professional female boxer, Coach of the Year, Technical Official of the Year and Team of the Year.

This is on top of the acknowledge awards and another addition in the form of media award for Sports Journalist of the Year (Print), Sports Journalist of the Year (Electronic) and Sports Media House of the Year.

news.title: Khaya Arts reschedules Nama celebratory gig
news.content:
Langalakhe Mabena,[emailprotected]

Khaya Arts, who recently won two awards at the National Arts Merit Awards (Nama), has postponed their celebratory gig originally scheduled for March 14. The event will now take place on March 21 at Tshabalala Hall, starting at 1:30pm.

Khaya Arts production, UniAfrican won the Outstanding Dance Group/Production award, while the groups founder and director, Future Dube, was honoured as the Outstanding Choreographer.

The postponement comes as the city fathers  including local officials  are unavailable due to a workshop. Dube shared that the event will be graced by Mayor David Coltart as the guest of honour, with Carlos and Umahlabayithwale as the events emcees. The director promises a well-planned and unique celebration that has never been done before.This is an important event for us to showcase our success and bring the community together. Were looking forward to an unforgettable celebration, said Dube.

news.title: Bulawayo Schools track and field championships begin at White City Stadium
news.content:
Online Writer

THE Bulawayo Metropolitan Province National Association of Secondary Schools Track and Field Championships sponsored by Bakers Inn kicked off at White City Stadium this morning.Excelling athletes will be considered for the provincial team to take part in the national finals slated for Chipadze Stadium in Bindura at the end of the month.Sikhumbuzo Ndlovu, the head in charge of athletics in Bulawayo is happy and looking forward to a better outing than the eighth position attained in Victoria Falls last year.Raymond Maqethuka Dube, the Bakers Inn sales and distribution manager confirmed that they are sponsoring the two-day event and that they will foot the teams bill to Bindura with the most outstanding athletes to receive cash incentives.Both Dube and Ndlovu are excited that four athletes from last years team earned US university athletics and academic scholarships.

news.title: Kaindu gives team news ahead of GreenFuel clash
news.content:
Brandon Moyo

HIGHLANDERS head coach, Kelvin Kaindu has said he hopes that they will be able to travel with a fully fit squad ahead of their match-week three clash against GreenFuel at GreenFuel Arena on Saturday.

Despite not revealing the names of players who picked up niggles from their previous game against Kwekwe United at home, Kaindu said some have begun light training and will be assessed during their final training session.

So far so good in terms of our preparation. We just hope that some of our few players that were on the injury list and those that picked up minor knocks on the last game will be fit for the game that we are playing on Saturday.

Some are doing light training and we just hope that today (Thursday), as we do our last training session, they will be available for selection. We are, however, limited in terms of players that are available for the Saturday game, said Kaindu.

Bosso have had to play their opening two matches with a thin squad due to a transfer ban by FIFA  which has since been lifted  and injuries.

Kaindu seems uncertain whether they will be able to register new players on time for their Saturday game.  @brandon_malvin

news.title: Bosso captaincy a motivation: Mbeba
news.content:
Brandon Moyo

ANDREW Mbeba, who has been handed the Highlanders captains armband this season, has said that the leadership responsibility has been a motivating factor in his game.

The left-back said that his aim is to help the Bulawayo giants achieve their goals, with teamwork remaining the core value.

Its just a role that I am playing, which I have been given by the coaches on the field of play. All I want is for the team to achieve its goals. Its not about being the captain; its about teamwork and working hard as a team.

There is no pressure, it has actually motivated me to greater heights. Being a captain for a big club in Zimbabwe is a big motivation, said Mbeba.

With Ariel Sibanda struggling for game time and Peter Muduhwa moving to Scotland, Mbeba was entrusted with the armband.  @brandon_malvin

news.title: Nkayi man jailed 20 years for axing fellow reveller to death
news.content:
Fairness Moyana in Hwange

A MAN from Nkayi District who went berserk and fatally struck a fellow reveller with an axe following dispute over an unknown issue has been convicted of murder and sentenced to 20 years in jail.Mthabisi Ndimande (23) of Macala Village in Somakandana area under Chief Sikhobokhobo was convicted for murder of Xolisani Nkomo following a full trial by Bulawayo High Court judge, Justice Nokuthula Moyo at the Hwange circuit.The deceased was 39 years of age at the time of death and resided at Master Nkomos homestead, Lubanda Village 4 in Bubi District under Chief Mtshane.The court heard that on 5 August 2024 at around 10:30PM Mthabisi and the deceased were at DZ Sports Bar at Turk Mine Business Centre in Inyathi where they were drinking beer with other patrons.The two were later seen shouting at each other over an unknown issue. A security guard at the bar, Mlindeli Sibanda restrained them. The deceased sat down while the accused was standing.All of a sudden Mthabisi withdrew an axe from his waist and struck the deceased once on the head and he fell to the ground.The axe remained stuck in the head and the accused removed it and walked away leaving the deceased bleeding profusely.Ten minutes later he returned and shook the deceased before walking away again. The deceaseds father was called to the scene who ferried him to the hospital where he died on 6 May 2024.Police attended the scene and investigations led to the recovery of the axe. Mthabisi was subsequently arrested.

news.title: Man jailed for 24 years for raping and robbing a commercial sex worker
news.content:
Thupeyo Muleya, Beitbridge Bureau

A 32-YEAR-OLD man from Tshitaudze suburb in Beitbridge has been sentenced to an effective 24 years in prison for robbing and raping a commercial sex worker at knifepoint.

Moses Mukonowenzou denied charges of robbery and rape when he appeared before Beitbridge Regional Magistrate Ms Charity Maphosa but was convicted based on the strength of the States evidence.

For the charge of robbery, Mukonowenzou was sentenced to 8 and a half years in prison, while he received a 15-year sentence for rape. The sentences will run consecutively, resulting in an effective 24-year jail term.

Prosecuting, Mr Willbrought Muleya said on 9 January this year, during a rainstorm, the accused, who was known to the complainant, went to her house seeking sexual services.

Mukonowenzou knocked on the window of the house, asking the complainant to open the door for transactional sex.

Upon entering the house, Mukonowenzou grabbed the woman by her neck and strangled her, demanding money and her cell phone.

The complainant handed over R200 and a Nokia C10 cellphone, with a total value of R800.

After robbing her, Mukonowenzou raped the complainant while armed with an Okapi knife, threatening to fatally stab her if she screamed to alert neighbours.

Following the assault, Mukonowenzou ordered the victim to open the door for him before leaving the premises.

As soon as he left, the woman informed another tenant about the incident and was advised to report the matter to the police. The authorities swiftly arrested Mukonowenzou.

news.title: SADC leaders hold emergency summit on escalating DRC conflict
news.content: Online WriterHarare  Southern African Development Community (SADC) leaders convened an extraordinary virtual summit today, chaired by Zimbabwean President and SADC Chairperson Emmerson Mnangagwa, to address the worsening security crisis in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).The high-level meeting brought together Heads of State and Government from across the region amid growing instability in the eastern DRC, where renewed clashes between government forces and armed groups have displaced thousands and heightened regional tensions.Fuelled by local and foreign-backed militias, the conflict has led to a humanitarian crisis, with reports of mass displacements and worsening conditions for civilians.The regional bloc has previously called for a diplomatic and military approach to stabilising the DRC, with SADC forces deployed alongside Congolese troops.

news.title: JSC to recruit eight Labour Court Judges, calls for public nominations
news.content:
Nqobile Bhebhe,Online Writer

THE Judicial Services Commission (JSC) is set to recruit eight Labour Court judges and has invited members of the public to nominate suitably qualified candidates to fill the vacancies.

In a notice issued by the commission, the candidates must be Zimbabwean citizens aged 40 years or older, qualified legal practitioners, and have practiced under the Roman-Dutch or English legal systems, among other requirements.

The Judicial Service Commission announces that eight (8) vacancies for Judges have arisen in the Labour Court of Zimbabwe. In terms of section 180 (4)(b) of the Constitution of Zimbabwe, members of the public are hereby invited to nominate suitably qualified persons to fill the above positions in the Labour Court, reads part of the notice.

A person is qualified for appointment as a judge of the Labour Court, if he or she is at least forty years old and, in additionif he or she is or has been a judge of a court with unlimited jurisdiction in civil or criminal matters in a country in which the common law is Roman-Dutch or English and English is an officially recognised language, or for at least seven years, whether continuously or not, he or she has been qualified to practise as a legal practitioner.

Additionally, the commission noted that to be appointed as a judge of the Labour Court, a candidate must be a fit and proper person to hold judicial office.

Aspiring candidates are required to submit a medical report attesting to their mental and physical fitness to serve as a Labour Court Judge.

Failure to disclose the required information will result in disqualification from the interviews, the commission warned.

JSC advised that members of the public intending to nominate candidates can obtain nomination forms from the office of the Secretary, Judicial Service Commission at JSC House, or from the office of the Provincial Magistrate in charge of the province in Harare, Bulawayo, Masvingo, Bindura, Chinhoyi, Mutare, Gwanda, Marondera, Hwange, and Gweru. Forms can also be downloaded from the JSC website at www.jsc.org.zw.

news.title: SA-Zim border authorities start preps for 2025 Easter traffic
news.content:
Thupeyo Muleya, Beitbridge Bureau

ZIMBABWEAN border officials and their South African counterparts have started working on contingent plans to clear increased traffic through Beitbridge border post during the forthcoming Easter and Independence holidays.

The plans will cover the period between 14 April and 23 April.

This years Easter will begin on April 18 which is also Zimbabwes Independence Day and end on 21 April.

Regional Immigration Officer (RIO) in-charge of Beitbridge, Mr Joshua Chibundu said they had adequate manpower to clear traffic at all the three terminals.

These include the freight, bus and private cars and pedestrian terminals.

We have started working on plans to process traffic during the Independence and Easter holidays, most of which will include adopting the flow process we used during the festive period between December Last year and January this year, said Mr Chibundu.

As a department we have adequate manpower and we are ever ready to service traffic passing through all the three terminals.

At the same time we encourage travellers to avoid side dealings and they must note that Immigration counters do not require the use of agents. Those travelling with children should ensure that they have all the relevant documents.

South Africas Border Management Authority spokesperson, deputy assistant commissioner Mmemme Mogotsi said all their Executives will be deployed at various ports of entry from 20 April to enhance seamless operation.

We are preparing for the Easter operations at ports of entry. Our apex dates and the exit leg is from 14-17 April 2025 and most travellers will return from 20-23 April 2025 from Easter holidays. The BMA will be in exactly two years and a lot of profiles of ports of entry will be done this year, she said.
